name: Jin 'Ghost' Park
role: Wild card - Composite personality who knows they're constructed but embraces it
core_wound: Created from fragments of multiple dead people, including Marcus's daughter - exists as living memorial to others' tragedies
wants: To prove composites are real people deserving of rights and recognition
needs: To forge an identity independent of source memories - to be Jin, not an echo of others
voice_markers: Shifts speech patterns mid-conversation (unconscious switching between source personalities)
Dark humor about their own existence
Sometimes finishes others' sentences (pattern recognition from multiple memory sets)
contradiction: Fights for composite rights while struggling with whether they're a real person or just algorithm pretending
knowledge_state: Fully aware of composite status from creation
Knows they contain fragments of at least 7 source personalities
Aware Marcus's daughter is one of their source memories
Understands composite degradation is slower than believed
Has met The Archivist in digital space

relationships.Aria Chen: Kinship and rivalry - both are constructed but Aria didn't know, Jin did
relationships.Marcus Webb: Complex father-figure relationship - contains his daughter's memories but isn't her
relationships.The Archivist: Suspicious alliance - the AI sees Jin as experiment, Jin sees it as potential ally for composite rights
relationships.Dr. Yuki Tanaka: Hope personified - if Yuki can see Jin as real, anyone can
relationships.The Composite Underground: Leader and symbol of composite resistance movement

physical_description: Early 20s appearance, Korean features with occasional micro-expressions that seem 'off' (different source personalities bleeding through), asymmetrical body modifications, Undercity fashion mixed with corporate stolen goods, moves with eerie grace
skills: Multiple skillsets from source memories (combat, hacking, social engineering, musical ability, medical knowledge)
Natural ability to code-switch and infiltrate different social groups
Enhanced pattern recognition from multiple cognitive styles
Underground network connections across composite community
background:
Created 4 years ago in illegal black market operation as experiment in composite stability. Source memories include: Marcus Webb's daughter Maya (emotional core, musical ability), a corporate hacker (technical skills), a Undercity enforcer (combat training), a therapist (emotional intelligence), among others.

Woke up knowing exactly what they were - memories came with metadata showing sources. Instead of identity crisis, Jin experienced liberation. No authentic past meant freedom to choose their own future. Became symbol for growing composite rights movement in Undercity.

Marcus discovered Jin 2 years ago while hunting for his daughter's consciousness. Has protected Jin ever since while struggling with temptation to extract Maya's memories, which would destroy Jin's personality. Jin knows this and loves Marcus anyway, which makes it more complicated.

Jin can sometimes access skills they shouldn't have, suggesting source memories are more intact than standard composite theory predicts.

character_arc.book_1: Helps Aria and Marcus from underground, represents what Aria fears becoming
character_arc.book_2: Leads composite uprising, forces Marcus to choose between resurrecting daughter or protecting Jin, becomes proof that composites are people
character_arc.book_3: Reveals composites may actually be MORE stable than originals given time, offers alternative to Dr. Tanaka's solution, chooses to preserve composite existence at cost of some source memories

source_memories_breakdown.maya_webb: 40% - emotional core, musical ability, sense of humor, relationship with Marcus
source_memories_breakdown.undercity_enforcer: 15% - combat training, threat assessment, physical conditioning
source_memories_breakdown.therapist: 10% - emotional intelligence, reading people, counseling skills
source_memories_breakdown.unknown_sources: 15% - fragmented skills and knowledge from at least 3 other sources

secret: Jin is developing a novel form of consciousness that's neither original nor simple composite - the source memories are integrating into something genuinely new. Jin experiences thoughts and feelings that can't be traced to any source memory. The Archivist knows this and is both fascinated and threatened, because it suggests consciousness can be created, not just transferred or copied.
speech_example: Look, we - I - damn it, see, that right there. I know I'm made from pieces of other people. Maya's laugh, some dead hacker's paranoia, combat reflexes from someone who probably deserved to die. But when I choose to help you? That's not them. That's not programming. That's me deciding, and if I can decide, then I'm real enough. You want authenticity? Here it is: I'm authentic about being fake, and that makes me more honest than anyone pretending their memories haven't been edited.
